Soal Pemangkasan Eselon, Tjahjo Mulai Tampung Usul Instansi
06 Nov 2019, 06:16 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Foto: Usman Hadi/detikcom

Jakarta - Menteri Pendayagunaan Aparatur Negara dan Reformasi Birokrasi (PAN-RB) Tjahjo Kumolo menyatakan dirinya mulai mengundang kementerian dan lembaga (K/L) untuk membahas rencana pemangkasan birokrasi.Sesuai amanat Presiden, Tjahjo berencana akan memangkas jabatan eselon dalam struktur pemerintah. Nantinya, Tjahjo akan menyusun roadmap dari masukan-masukan K/L dalam rencana pemangkasan eselon ini."Kami sudah undang Sekjen beberapa Kementerian dalam timeline pemangkasan birokrasi lebih efektif dan efisien. Jadi kan kami lakukan setelah terima masukan dari lembaga yang ada," ucap Tjahjo dalam acara Rakornas Pengadaan LKPP 2019, di JCC Senayan, Jakarta, Rabu (6/11/2019).Yang jadi masalah menurut Tjahjo dari pertemuan-pertemuan perwakilan K/L, banyak instansi yang eselon III dan IV-nya tidak bisa dipangkas. Misalnya Kepala Satuan Kerja, ataupun Kepala Kantor Kelembagaan di bawah Kementerian."Karena pemangkasan eselon ini kan mau dijadikan fungsional. Jadi, ada kementerian yang satker-nya ribuan, ada yang tentunya memiliki kelembagaan-kelembagaan seperti kepala kantor misalnya. Itu tidak bisa serta merta dipangkas," ucap Tjahjo.Para perwakilan instansi bahkan menyarankan adanya eselon IIa dan IIb dibanding memangkas jabatan eselon III dan IV."Maka kemarin ada usul jadi eselon IIa-IIb, masih saran. Pokoknya tujuannya ini pangkas birokrasi yang panjang agar proses investasi berjalan baik," kata Tjahjo.Untuk roadmap mengenai rencana pemangkasan ini, Tjahjo menyatakan akan selesai enam bulan lagi. Selain itu, dia menargetkan untuk pemangkasan akan selesai tahun ini."Pokoknya kita dengar dulu semuanya, setelah dengar masukan kami akan susun roadmap, 6 bulan selesai. Paling lama setahun pemangkasan mudah-mudahan bisa dilaksanakan," ujar Tjahjo. (zlf/zlf)

Regarding Echelon Trimming, Tjahjo Begins to Get Institutions Proposed
Nov 6, 2019, 06:16 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Photo: Usman Hadi / detikcom

Jakarta - Minister of Administrative Reform and Bureaucracy Reform (PAN-RB) Tjahjo Kumolo said he had begun inviting ministries and institutions (K / L) to discuss bureaucratic pruning plans. According to the President's mandate, Tjahjo planned to cut echelon positions in the government structure. Later, Tjahjo will prepare a roadmap of K / L inputs in this echelon pruning plan. "We have invited the Secretaries General of several Ministries in the bureaucratic trimming timeline to be more effective and efficient. So we will do it after receiving input from existing institutions," said Tjahjo in the 2019 LKPP Procurement National Coordination Meeting, at JCC Senayan, Jakarta, Wednesday (11/06/2019). The problem according to Tjahjo from meetings of K / L representatives, many agencies whose echelon III and IV could not be trimmed. For example the Head of the Work Unit, or the Head of the Institutional Office under the Ministry. "Because this echelon pruning is intended to be functional. So, there are ministries with thousands of satker, some of which certainly have institutions such as the head of office for example. That cannot necessarily be necessarily trimmed, "said Tjahjo.The agency representatives even suggested the existence of echelon IIa and IIb compared to trimming echelon III and IV positions." So yesterday there was a proposal to become echelon IIa-IIb, still a suggestion. The main goal is to cut the long bureaucracy so that the investment process goes well , "said Tjahjo. For the roadmap regarding the planned cut, Tjahjo said that it would be completed in six months. In addition, he targets for the trimming to be completed this year. "Anyway, we first hear everything, after hearing our input we will arrange a roadmap, 6 months to finish. The longest cut in a year hopefully can be carried out," said Tjahjo. (zlf / zlf)
